page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: The area is located in Glasgow, south of the river Clyde. It contains the historic parishes of Govan, Cathcart, and Eastwood. The area is essentially residential, although the quality and type of housing varies considerably within. The use of sandstone as a building material is common as in many areas of Glasgow. Industry and commerce within the area is confined to two sites, in the extreme N.East (POLMADIE) and on the western fringe (POLLOKSHAWS).Shopping facilities are concentrated at Shawlands Cross, Kilmarnock Road and Victoria Road. The land rises in a southerly direction(3o-6om.). The area has large amounts of open space including three major public parks. Also included in the area is the national football stadium.
